DataElement.preferredName: Cell Vaccine Preparation To Administration Elapsed Time Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Number of hours from preparation of vaccine to viability after administration.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Vaccine Preparation Creation To Administration Duration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A special type of antigen-presenting cell (APC) that activates T lymphocytes._The act or process of making something ready; also an anatomic or pathologic specimen made ready and preserved for study._The process by which something is brought into existence; having been brought into existence._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._Performing or possessing executive duties; acting as a supervisor or manager._The period of time during which something continues.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Suspensions of killed or attentuated microorganisms (bacteria, viruses, or rickettsiae), or of antigenic proteins derived from them, administered for the prevention, amelioration, or treatment of infectious diseases or cancer.:The act or process of making something ready; also a medication made ready for administration; also an anatomic or pathologic specimen made ready and preserved for study.

Concepts.definition: Preparations containing substances with antigenic properties administered to activate the immune system, thereby inducing an immune response.
The act or process of making something ready.

Property.preferredDefinition: Brought into existence.:No Value Exists:Performing or possessing executive duties; acting as a supervisor or manager.:The period of time during which something continues.

Concepts.definition: The process by which something is brought into existence; having been brought into existence.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
Performing or possessing executive duties; acting as a supervisor or manager.
The period of time during which something continues.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Replaces v1.0 by making this CDE more generic, not limited to dendritic cell vaccines.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The act or process of making something ready; also a medication made ready for administration; also an anatomic or pathologic specimen made ready and preserved for study._The period of time during which something continues._A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The act or process of making something ready; also a medication made ready for administration; also an anatomic or pathologic specimen made ready and preserved for study.:The period of time during which something continues.:In modern usage, an hour is defined as a unit of time 60 minutes, or 3600 seconds in length. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: The act or process of making something ready.
The period of time during which something continues.
A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support Duke University adoption of C3D. v2.0 replaces v1.0 with removal of 'dendritic cell' qualifier.
